greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: coefficients of polynomials arising from the recurrence A[n](x) = A[n-1]'(x)/(1-x) with A[0] = exp(x).
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Rows 0 through 25 of the triangle, together with the corresponding polynomials P[n](x).
formula: Let A[0](x) = exp(x), A[n](x) = A[n-1]'(x)/(1-x) for n>0 and let P[n](x) = A[n](x)*(1-x)^(2n-1)/exp(x). Row n of triangle gives coefficients of P[n](x) with exponents of x in decreasing order.
example: The first few polynomials P[n] (n >= 0) are:
xref: Columns give A001515 (really A144301), A144498, A001514, A144506, A144507. Row sums give A001147. Alternating row sums give A043301.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 14 2008
